entries.title: US Congress passes new election rules in response to January 6
entries.description: New provisions to US Electoral Count Act make it more difficult for politicians to prevent peaceful transfer of power.

entries.title: Bankman-Fried, FTX execs received billions in hidden loans
entries.description: Caroline Ellison, Bankman-Fried's colleague, said she agreed with him to hide the loans from FTX investors.

entries.title: Britain’s health workers announce more strikes for 2023
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak says he is 'sad' and 'disappointed' about widespread strikes but refuses to negotiate.

entries.title: US House passes massive $1.7 trillion spending bill
entries.description: Bill boosts military spending by 10 percent to a total of $858bn, alongside $772.5bn for domestic programmes.

entries.title: 5 key takeaways from January 6 panel’s report on US Capitol riot
entries.description: Donald Trump led 'multi-part conspiracy' to overturn 2020 elections that ended in deadly riot, US committee says.

entries.title: Putin tells defence chiefs to do more for troops in Ukraine
entries.description: Russian leader says the country's military-industrial complex should provide the army with everything they need.

entries.title: Could the world be facing another major coronavirus outbreak?
entries.description: COVID infections are rising in China and there are growing fears that new variants could emerge.

entries.title: Photos: Massive winter storm pummels US and Canada
entries.description: Frigid temperatures, snow and ice have upended travel plans and knocked out power to thousands of homes and businesses.

entries.title: Billionaire Adani to own 65% of India’s NDTV as founders sell
entries.description: NDTV founders Radhika and Prannoy Roy made several unsuccessful attempts to block the takeover by Gautam Adani.

entries.title: UN envoy calls for pressure on Taliban over women university ban
entries.description: Gordon Brown urges more leaders in Islamic countries to denounce a move barring Afghan women from higher education.

entries.title: Chile declares state of emergency after wildfire leaves one dead
entries.description: Massive blaze near the tourist city of Vina del Mar has killed at least one person and destroyed about 200 homes.

entries.title: US consumer spending, inflation cool in November
entries.description: While economic activity is slowing amid rising interest rates, it's not enough to discourage US Fed from more rises.

entries.title: Media mogul Mike Bloomberg looks to buy WSJ or WaPo: Report
entries.description: A merger would create a financial data and news giant, further firming up the world's 12th-richest man's stronghold.

entries.title: Facebook parent Meta to pay $725m in Cambridge Analytica scandal
entries.description: Agreed settlement is largest in US data privacy class action and the biggest class action lawsuit for Meta.

entries.title: The Case for the Climate
entries.description: earthrise meets some of the environmental campaigners and lawyers who are forcing systemic change through the courts.

entries.title: Photos: After heavy combat, Ukrainians in east brace for cold
entries.description: Villages in the Donetsk region have seen heavy fighting, and now residents are facing a new threat: a bitter winter.

entries.title: Burkina Faso government expels senior UN official
entries.description: Violence from multiple armed groups in Burkina Faso has displaced more than two million people.

entries.title: Spain absolves border agents over Melilla asylum seeker deaths
entries.description: At least 23 people died after a mass storming of the border crossing between Morocco and the Spanish enclave.

entries.title: M23 rebels pledge to retreat from key position in eastern DRC
entries.description: Violence from the group has caused hundreds of thousands of people to flee in fear from the DRC's volatile east region.

entries.title: One-day tally of COVID cases in China hits 37 million: Report
entries.description: The latest figures deviate significantly from official data sparking concerns over China's transparency on the issue.

entries.title: Togo presidency to oversee armed forces amid security woes
entries.description: The move comes after recent incidents of armed group activity in the country's north, near the border with Burkina Faso.

entries.title: Economic ties head the agenda as Italy’s Meloni visits Iraq
entries.description: Meloni, who is in Baghdad on her first bilateral trip outside Europe, hailed Italy's support for Iraq.

entries.title: England’s Sam Curran becomes most expensive IPL player
entries.description: Punjab Kings agreed to pay $2.23m for the all-rounder at the Indian cricket league's auction of players.

entries.title: Indian activist Umar Khalid gets a week’s bail — and a gag order
entries.description: A court awarded Khalid a seven-day reprieve to attend his sister's wedding, after more than two years in jail.

entries.title: Looking at Berlin’s present through its past
entries.description: What can an exhibition on 19th-century migrants in Berlin tell us about Germany's current relationship with migration?

entries.title: Q&A: Uganda’s Museveni on staying in power, rights abuses
entries.description: The Museveni administration has repeatedly been accused of muzzling dissenting voices in the country since 1986.

entries.title: Japan unveils record defence budget amid regional security fears
entries.description: The cabinet's nod for a 20-percent rise in military spending is a deviation from pacifist post-WWII self-defence policy.

entries.title: Shell to pay $15m settlement over oil spills in Nigeria
entries.description: Shell claimed the settlement for spills in the Niger Delta between 2004 and 2007 was not an admission of liability.

entries.title: At least two people dead after shooting in Paris
entries.description: Gunshots were fired in a central district of Paris, injuring several people.

entries.title: COP15 was a success — here’s what needs to happen next
entries.description: The historic global agreement at the UN conference to halt and reverse biodiversity loss by 2030 is just the start.

entries.title: Passport control staff strike at six UK airports for better pay
entries.description: More than 1,000 Border Force officers walk out at six airports over pay amid the cost-of-living crisis.

entries.title: Heavy snow and plunging temperatures: What is a bomb cyclone?
entries.description: The United States braces for a cold snap as wind-chill temperatures could drop to dangerous levels far below zero.

entries.title: Lobster bisque for the blues
entries.description: A father and daughter’s journey through sadness and seafood.

entries.title: Russia threatens to slash oil supplies in 2023, spooks markets
entries.description: Moscow warns it may cut production by 5-7 percent in early 2023 as energy war with the West deepens.

entries.title: Suicide car bomb kills Pakistan police officer, wounds others
entries.description: Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan claims responsibility for explosion near police headquarters in Islamabad.

entries.title: Israeli police kill Palestinian, accuse him of ‘attack’
entries.description: Family denies the Palestinian citizen of Israel had attempted to ram Israeli officers with a car in Kafr Qasim.

entries.title: Winter ‘bomb cyclone’ looms ahead of US holiday weekend
entries.description: A 'once-in-a-generation' winter storm with temperatures as low as -40 degrees Celsius causes Christmas travel chaos.

entries.title: Timeline: Case of Charles Sobhraj – ‘Bikini Killer’, ‘Serpent’
entries.description: The French serial killer preyed on Western tourists on the 'hippie trail' in Asia in the 1970s and 1980s.

entries.title: French serial killer Charles Sobhraj released from Nepal prison
entries.description: He spent 19 years in jail in Nepal for two murders in 1975 and was freed given his age and for good behaviour.

entries.title: Children can help us build a better, greener world for all
entries.description: Children are bearing the brunt of the world’s ills. Let’s ensure their voices are heard.

entries.title: China’s foreign minister warns US not to cross its ‘red line’
entries.description: Wang Yi accuses the US of 'salami slicing' tactics and 'bullying' in a call with Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

entries.title: Powerful Tunisian trade union calls for postponement of vote
entries.description: UGTT says second round will cause chaos after a record-low turnout in the first round of parliamentary elections.

entries.title: N Korea fires 2 ballistic missiles towards eastern waters: South
entries.description: Latest launch comes days after joint air exercise by South Korean and US militaries.

entries.title: Thomas Piketty: ‘You have to make the richest people pay more’
entries.description: Renowned economist Thomas Piketty on the politics of building global equality.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 303
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 303rd day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: Apple’s Australian workers go on Christmas strike over pay
entries.description: Strike comes as tech giant is facing disruption at its flagship iPhone plant in China after workers' protests.

entries.title: Cambodia convicts 36 opposition members in latest mass trial
entries.description: Mass trial of Cambodia's opposition leaders and supporters results in guilty verdicts for all but one defendant.

entries.title: Japan’s inflation hits 40-year high
entries.description: Prices rise 3.7 percent in November amid growing expectations central bank will roll back huge stimulus.

entries.title: US says Putin’s call to end war in Ukraine insincere
entries.description: 'Our goal is not to spin the flywheel of military conflict,' Russian President Vladimir Putin said.

entries.title: As Indonesia woos investors, ‘sex ban’ laws convolute sales pitch
entries.description: Southeast Asian country's businesses community is divided on how revised code will affect efforts to attract investment.

entries.title: January 6 panel unveils report, describes Trump ‘conspiracy’
entries.description: Jan 6 committee’s final report asserts Donald Trump engaged in a 'multi-part conspiracy' to overturn 2020 election.

entries.title: Russia considers ways to return space crew after capsule leak
entries.description: Tests are being conducted to determine whether Soyuz capsule is unfit for crewed flight after coolant leak.

entries.title: N Korea denies arms supplied for Russian mercenaries in Ukraine
entries.description: US claims North Korea sent 'infantry rockets and missiles into Russia' for use by Wagner Group mercenaries in Ukraine.

entries.title: TikTok staff accessed data to track journalists, ByteDance finds
entries.description: Chinese parent company of popular video app says the employees responsible are no longer with the company.

entries.title: Argentina identifies 131st baby kidnapped during dictatorship
entries.description: A right-wing dictatorship that ruled Argentina from 1976 to 1983 systematically stole children from dissident parents.

entries.title: US Senate passes $1.7t spending bill without Afghan refugee law
entries.description: The 4,155-page spending bill includes $858bn for military spending and $45bn in additional assistance for Ukraine.
